content.raw:
I just reverted that commenting out of code (db6b323) and added another commit to require sdformat 3.0.0 (e7a0bcf)

Because we are using find_package and sdformat declares SameMajorVersion in its config file, find_package(SDFormat, 2) fails if 3.0 is installed.
content.html:
I just reverted that commenting out of code (db6b323) and added another commit to require sdformat 3.0.0 (e7a0bcf)

Because we are using find_package and sdformat declares SameMajorVersion in its config file, find_package(SDFormat, 2) fails if 3.0 is installed.

content.raw: @chapulina caught a major bug with the model editor after this PR got merged: models made in the ModelEditor fall through the ground plane, which means they probably have collide_bitmask=0x0 or >0xff (even with the correct sdf branch). We are looking into it now.
content.html: @chapulina caught a major bug with the model editor after this PR got merged: models made in the ModelEditor fall through the ground plane, which means they probably have collide_bitmask=0x0 or >0xff (even with the correct sdf branch). We are looking into it now.

content.html: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issue/73/self_collide-should-be-a-model-property

content.html: It would make a good follow-up PR

content.raw: It does seem more intuitive and convenient that there should be a model property that sets all links to self-collide unless overridden by links, but that's probably out of the scope of this PR.
content.html: It does seem more intuitive and convenient that there should be a model property that sets all links to self-collide unless overridden by links, but that's probably out of the scope of this PR.

content.raw:
`self_collide` needs to be set for each link. I just committed eb36ef3c944b to your branch as an illustration.

If that is too inconvenient, we could make a simple model plugin that sets all links to have a single value of `self_collide`. Or we could add  `self_collide` as a model property that links can override?
content.html:
self_collide needs to be set for each link. I just committed eb36ef3c944b to your branch as an illustration.

If that is too inconvenient, we could make a simple model plugin that sets all links to have a single value of self_collide. Or we could add self_collide as a model property that links can override?

content.raw: Not right now. It would break gazebo for people who do not have the correct version of sdformat.
content.html: Not right now. It would break gazebo for people who do not have the correct version of sdformat.

content.raw: Also resolves #899.
content.html: Also resolves #899.

content.raw: `self_collide` is needed. Under the hood, when self_collide==false (the default) all links in a model are lumped into a collision space. When `true` each link is in a different collision space. The default has better performance.
content.html: self_collide is needed. Under the hood, when self_collide==false (the default) all links in a model are lumped into a collision space. When true each link is in a different collision space. The default has better performance.

content.raw: See also #899
content.html: See also #899

content.raw: I think this is related to the [self_collide sdformat tag](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=link#link_self_collide). That's a good point @jacquelinekay ; we should figure out how the bit mask will work with `self_collide`. Do we need both? @hsu
content.html: I think this is related to the self_collide sdformat tag. That's a good point @jacquelinekay ; we should figure out how the bit mask will work with self_collide. Do we need both? @hsu

content.raw:
In 96fad97, branch collide_bitmask_jackie, I modified `collide_bitmask.world` so that the boxes are all links of the same model. I would expect it to look like the picture Steve posted above. Instead it looks the links do not collide:

![nocollide.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/702316189-nocollide.png)

Can you give an example of a single model with collision bitmasks for the individual links?
content.html:
In 96fad97, branch collide_bitmask_jackie, I modified collide_bitmask.world so that the boxes are all links of the same model. I would expect it to look like the picture Steve posted above. Instead it looks the links do not collide:

Can you give an example of a single model with collision bitmasks for the individual links?

content.raw: This implementation should be the most general purpose, but also the most verbose. You may have to specify a bitmask on each collision element to achieve the desired behavior, but it is possible to get any (within the range of integer values) combination of collisions.
content.html: This implementation should be the most general purpose, but also the most verbose. You may have to specify a bitmask on each collision element to achieve the desired behavior, but it is possible to get any (within the range of integer values) combination of collisions.

content.html: does there need to be a gazebo_modelschange for the collide_bitmask of ground_plane there, as well?

content.raw: right, there could even be inter-link collisions since a link can have multiple collisions...
content.html: right, there could even be inter-link collisions since a link can have multiple collisions...

content.raw: I'll clarify that surface is a collision-level property, but I think your comment is still relevant.
content.html: I'll clarify that surface is a collision-level property, but I think your comment is still relevant.

content.raw: It would be cool if collision bitmasks affected link-level collisions within a model, especially since surface is a link-level property, but it looks like this PR only manages bitmasks at the model level. Are there future plans to implement link-level collisions?
content.html: It would be cool if collision bitmasks affected link-level collisions within a model, especially since surface is a link-level property, but it looks like this PR only manages bitmasks at the model level. Are there future plans to implement link-level collisions?

content.raw:
This is currently not backwards compatible, such that building this branch of gazebo without the proper sdformat branch causes [massive failures](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/485). Things could be improved by the following check in `SurfaceParams.cc`:
~~~
if (contactElem->HasElement("collide_bitmask"))
  this->collideBitmask =
    contactElem->Get<unsigned int>("collide_bitmask");
~~~
Otherwise, we would need to require a new minimum version of sdformat.
content.html:
This is currently not backwards compatible, such that building this branch of gazebo without the proper sdformat branch causes massive failures. Things could be improved by the following check in SurfaceParams.cc:

if (contactElem->HasElement("collide_bitmask"))
  this->collideBitmask =
    contactElem->Get<unsigned int>("collide_bitmask");

Otherwise, we would need to require a new minimum version of sdformat.
